 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִסַּת‎</span> **noun** ==sufficiency== (derivation obscure: Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מִיסַּת‎</span>, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, common in [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] [[BDB#Syr|ᵑ6]], both absolute and construct in sense of ***sufficiency, enough***; e.g. for Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רַב‎</span> [[2Sam.24.16|2Sam 24:16]] [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דַּי‎</span> [[Exod.36.7|Exod 36:7]] [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] [[BDB#Syr|ᵑ6]], [[Obad.1.5|Obad 1:5]] [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] [[BDB#Syr|ᵑ6]], for <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְפִי‎</span> [[Exod.12.4|Exod 12:4]] [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]]; <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> the ***amount*** of the debt, [[BDB#PS|PS]]<sup>2183</sup>); — [[Deut.16.10|Deut 16:10]] and thou shalt keep the pilgrimage of weeks <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִסַּת נִדְבַת יָָֽדְךָ‎</span> ***according to*** (adverb accusative) ***the sufficiency of*** the free-will offering of thy hand, which thou shalt give, i.e. with the full amount that thou canst afford (compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דֵּי שֶׂשׁה‎</span> [[Lev.5.7|Lev 5:7]]; [[Lev.12.8|Lev 12:8]] [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כְּמִיסַּת אִימְּרָא‎</span>). <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִסְתּוֺר‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַסְתֵּר‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִסְתָּר‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סתר‎</span>. [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַעְבָּד‎</span>] see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עבד‎</span>. [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַעֲבֶה‎</span>] see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עבה‎</span>. [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַעֲבָר‎</span>], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַעְבָּרָה‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עבר‎</span>. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַעְגָּל‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַעְגָּ֫לָה‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עגל‎</span>.
